awd_titl_txt: Travel: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2024 IEEE International Conference on Quantum Computing and Engineering (QCE)
awd_abstract_narration:
The IEEE International Conference on Quantum Computing and Engineering 2024 (QCE), scheduled for September 15th–20th in Montréal, Québec, Canada, is an event that brings together a diverse group of participants, including researchers, scientists, engineers, entrepreneurs, developers, students, practitioners, educators, and programmers. It's an initiative co-sponsored by several IEEE societies such as the Quantum Initiative, Computer Society, Communications Society, Photonics Society, Council on Superconductivity, and technically co-sponsored by the Technology & Engineering Management Society and the Electronics Packaging Society. The conference serves as a multidisciplinary forum for discussing the challenges and opportunities in quantum computing and engineering.

This proposal provides travel support for approximately twenty undergraduate and graduate students in the United States to attend this premiere conference. The travel awards will target first-time attendees and under-represented minority students, recognizing the importance of conference participation in their educational journey and addressing the often-limited availability of travel funds. This initiative is beneficial not just for the students, but also for the broader research community and the Quantum Information Science and Engineering workforce, as it fosters the development of new talent and brings fresh perspectives to the field.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
IEEE International Conference on Quantum Computing and Engineering (QCE24), co-sponsored by IEEE Quantum Initiative, IEEE Computer Society, IEEE Communications Society, IEEE Photonics Society, and IEEE Council on Superconductivity as well as technically co-sponsored by IEEE Technology & Engineering Management Society and IEEE Electronics Packaging Society, was be held from September 15th – September 20th, 2024 at Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Priority will be given to students who will benefit from attending this conference, but are unlikely to attend due to the unavailability of travel funding.

The QCE 2024 conference has formed an Exceptional Program with 80 Exhibitor, Sponsors and Supporters featuring technologies from quantum companies, start-ups and research labs. QCE24, the Fifth IEEE International Conference on Quantum Computing and Engineering, features a career fair, a student mentorship program, 9 world-class keynote speakers, 36 workforce-building tutorials, 35 community-building workshops, 222 stellar technical papers, 16 stimulating panels, 140 innovative posters, and 6 Birds-of-a-Feather sessions.

QCE24 Launches Its First Student Travel Grant Program. QCE24 is offering student travel grants on acompetitive basis to support students registered for the conference. Sponsored by the U.S. National ScienceFoundation (NSF) and the IEEE Computer Society (CS), these grants aim to increase participation, particularlyamong students who might otherwise face financial barriers to attending. Special consideration is givento women, minorities, undergraduate or early-stage graduate students, and first-time QCE attendees. The conference received 74 applications for the QCE24 travel grant. 30 applicants applied for NSF-sponsored grants. After a thorough evaluation by the committee, the commitee recommends awarding 20 NSF travel grants and 29 IEEE travel grants, including 10 dedicated to diversity and inclusion.

 


Last Modified: 04/02/2025
Modified by: Tu Ngoc Nguyen
